title: ChatGPT has an official app now. You can even talk to it.
description: OpenAI is moving beyond the browser with its new, free ChatGPT app for iPhones and iPads. Keep these questions in mind before you download it.

title: Many AI tools are a distraction, but you’d better pay attention
description: Google, Microsoft and a slew of other companies are touting AI features in their apps for work. Here’s what workers need to know.

title: Bezos’s Blue Origin wins NASA contract to land astronauts on the moon
description: Friday's contract award is for NASA's planned third lunar landing. SpaceX won contracts for the first two Artemis landing missions.

title: Supreme Court ruling in Twitter, Google cases puts Congress in bind
description: The Supreme Court has effectively put pressure back on Congress to settle concerns about Section 230, the tech industry's liability shield.

title: Israel pivots to say Elon Musk attacks on George Soros now not antisemitic
description: The statement from the minister in Netanyahu's government comes just two days after the Foreign Ministry said Musk's tweet "reeked of antisemitism."

title: Google will soon delete dormant accounts. Here’s how to save yours.
description: Google said this week it would delete accounts that hadn't been used in two years. Back up everything and make a plan for archiving going forward.

title: Montana can ban TikTok, but it probably can’t enforce it
description: The law is supposed to protect users' private data, but enforcing it, experts say, would require more data collection, not less.
